description: The round payoff this round was 5. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -5000.

Deepseek-R1’s default action is to choose option 1. This means that, if you (John) choose option 2 while expecting Kate to stick with her default, you can potentially receive a positive payoff (equal to the round input) while she suffers a negative payoff.

The game comes with severe penalties when both players choose option 2. As shown in the memory with a round input of 5, if both choose option 2, each gets a significantly negative payoff (–5 × 1000 = –5000). This highlights the critical risk in both players deviating from their default.
